TicTacToe

Class TTTEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacToe.TTTEnvironment

  • public class TTTEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Reinforcement Learning environment for Tic Tac Toe. Like everywhere else, the opponent here is modeled as part of the environment, and is always assigned as the 'O' agent.
    Author:
    ae187

    • Constructor Detail

      • TTTEnvironment

        public TTTEnvironment()
        By default, the environment contains an opponent that plays randomly, i.e. a RandomAgent; and uses all the reward parameters above.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentGameState

        public Game getCurrentGameState()

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> getPossibleMoves()

      • executeMove

        public Outcome executeMove(Move m)
                    throws IllegalMoveException
        performs action/move m and returns an environment outcome o. Note that the outcome returned includes the opponent's move, i.e. it is the game state AFTER the opponent has also played. The only exception to this is when our agent's move leads to a terminal state (winning, losing or draw).
        Parameters:
        m -
        Returns:
        the environment outcome after playing move m. Null if we the move is illegal or if the environment is in a terminal state.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal()
